notes: Scope includes planning for requested chat/social/planner feature surface.
Implementation should follow progressive waves to keep platform stable.

features: message input with attachments and mic hooks
task assignment from chat or group actions

tasks.title: Component Contract Catalog
deliverables: Data and socket event dependencies for each component.
Fallback behavior for unavailable backend capabilities.
acceptance_criteria: Every component is linked to explicit backend/API/socket requirements.
No hidden dependency on undocumented events.

tasks.title: Responsive Layout Standards
deliverables: Responsive constraints for large monitors, desktop, laptop, tablet, and mobile.
Performance budgets for high-density chat timelines and media cards.
acceptance_criteria: Primary component layouts are validated for all required viewports.
Interaction parity and accessibility baseline are documented.

tasks.title: Feature Dependency And Rollout Governance
deliverables: Feature flag and compatibility model for incremental rollout.
Dependency graph between component waves and socket/kafka/schema readiness.
Rollback plan for event-schema mismatch incidents.
acceptance_criteria: Large feature sets can be enabled progressively without breaking core chat.
Rollout risk is bounded through feature gating and observability hooks.

tasks.title: Component Certification Gates And Release Readiness Scoring
deliverables: Per-component certification checklist: accessibility, i18n, RTL, performance budget, and test coverage thresholds.
Contract-test generation rules that bind component events to canonical socket/API schemas.
Wave readiness scoring model combining dependency status, quality gates, and operational risk.
Escalation policy when component dependencies lag behind planned feature wave.
acceptance_criteria: Components cannot enter stable release without certification checklist completion.
Wave promotion requires dependency and contract-test pass criteria.
Readiness score and blocking reasons are visible to implementation teams.
